elements.title: Washington DC Snowball Fight Association
elements.contents: ... that the Washington DC Snowball Fight Association was formed when around 2,000 people showed up to a snowball fight (pictured) organized over Facebook?

elements.title: Emily Sutton
elements.contents: ... that Emily Sutton illustrated an abridged children's edition of Shakespeare's First Folio with "red-cheeked gentlemen, sword-wielding warriors and ladies in striking attire"?

elements.title: Thone Myo Shin
elements.contents: ... that gamblers in Myanmar worship the spirit Thone Myo Shin to ensure victory in cockfights?

elements.title: John A. Jakle
elements.contents: ... that John A. Jakle has co-authored nine books on "roadside America", including books on motels, road signs, gas stations, parking lots, and fast-food restaurants?

elements.title: Higher Than Heaven
elements.contents: ... that Ellie Goulding tied Adele for the most UK number one albums by a British female artist when Higher Than Heaven topped the charts?

elements.title: Robert Van de Graaff
elements.contents: ... that Robert Van de Graaff, inventor of the Van de Graaff generator, turned to physics after injuries kept him from playing football at Alabama?

elements.title: Kururin Squash!
elements.contents: ... that an unlockable vehicle in Kururin Squash! contains a reference to Super Mario Bros. by honking the horn?

elements.title: Lozi Kingdom
elements.contents: ... that the kingship ideology of the Lozi Kingdom emphasised powerful ancestral royal spirits, believed to affect the present?

elements.title: USS Anzio
elements.contents: ... that the Casablanca-class escort carrier USS Anzio once took the place of an entire fleet?
